about_the_game:
Free Range Games are proud to present the official Art Exhibition of Lord of the Rings: Return to Moria!

From the moment we began working on Return to Moria, the world of J.R.R. Tolkien’s Lord of the Rings has inspired the Free Range Games artists. We all share vivid memories of poring over hand-drawn maps of Middle-earth, and marveling at the original illustrations in the first editions. So we always knew we wanted to bring this world to life through visuals in our game. The Digital Art Exhibition takes the reader through not only our game development process, but on a journey through the past few years as we share our love for the art of The Lord of the Rings.

Chapter Listing

The World Below - The design of the diverse environments found in Moria, from the upper city of Dwarrowdelf to the wilds of the Lower Deeps

The Dwarves - The design of the Dwarves, including the original inhabitants of Khazad-dûm, and the many different tribes that answered Gimli’s call

Dwarven Craft - A look at the huge variety of armor, weapons, and other cultural artifacts that add to the living world of Moria

Servants of Evil - A description of the varied Orc and Goblin tribes that inhabit the different levels of Moria, from the feral creatures of the Deeps to the Uruks of Mordor

Creatures of the Deep - A look at the wide variety of fauna, from beasts of nature, to fouler things that prowl in the deep spaces of the world

Art Direction

BRADLEY FULTON

Concept Art

PAVEL HRISTOV MATTEO SPIRITO SAMUELE BANDINI TIM MCBURNIE MASSINISSA BELABBAS JOB MENTING HARRISON FONG HAKOB MINASIAN TIMOTHEE MATHON

Key Art

PAUL SCOTT CANAVAN MATTEO SPIRITO

Cartography

THIBAUD JACQUIER-BRET

3D Art

SAM GREER TY MIYASATO SABRINA (YAO) YAO TAIBIN ZHANG VINCENT RILEY MARTINA STUPARIĆ MARTIN HORVATIĆ RYAN BUCK WESTLEY FORLEO-MAGUIRE STEWART MORRISON AO LI

With Additional Assets By

1518 STUDIOS NXA STUDIOS SYSTEM STUDIOS STUDIO 369 MASSIVE BLACK MLC (MAGNA LUDUM CREATIVES

Once installed, the files will default to be placed into your Steam folder. For most users that will be \Steam\steamapps\common\The Lord of the Rings Return to Moria™\Moria_ArtExhibitionFINALFINAL.pdf.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

short_description: Middle-earth is a setting of incredible richness and narrative depth. In a world where trees can talk and mountains can move, every stone might have a story. In the Digital Art Exhibition, we explore how the Free Range Team created the world that players explore in Return to Moria.
